title: Why Coral Lipstick Is the Best Valentine’s Day Makeup Hack
text: This Runway-Tested Lipstick Color Will Have You Swapping Out Classic Red February 11, 2017 11:02 PM 1 / 11 Photographed by Mario Testino, Vogue , March 2006 Classics are classics for good reason: There’s no denying the appeal of a little black dress and cherry lipstick, the de facto sartorial punctuation marks that often accompany date-night dressing. But the unexpected has a way of making the eye linger—exactly the point—which is reason enough to retool your Valentine’s Day beauty game with a vibrant coral lip. The Spring runways served up ample inspiration, with fluoro-bright mouths at Jason Wu and a traffic-cone take on orange-red at Versus Versace, sounding out a bold-is-better message loud and clear. How you interpret that catwalk shade in real life—whether to go ultra-matte or playfully glossy, poppy or persimmon—is the fun part, and these 10 variations on a theme are a place to start. Giorgio Armani’s Ecstasy Lacquer in Tangerine goes strong on shine with a vibrant glide-on formula, while Burberry’s creamy Liquid Lip Velvet (in Bright Crimson) leaves a sophisticated flat finish. Givenchy’s Satin Collection (in Orange Adrenaline) packs antioxidants into its bow-trimmed packaging, and Hourglass Cosmetics’s satiny Girl Lip Stylo (in Explorer) calls on shea butter and jojoba to deeply nourish lips. For a holiday like this, that might be just the right prescription. In This Story: Valentine's Day , Lipstick Recommended For You
